ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Advanced grammar skills, better vocab, and improved writing.
I believe that the professor and the course were great for the development of my French skills. I believe overall my languages skills improved.
Better French vocab and grammar, the ability to talk about movies and texts in French. A bunch of French speaking and writing practice.
Improved speaking abilities greatly, vocabulary expanded, and grammar.

The course builds a sound foundation for writing and speaking in French. You know that feeling when you'd love to say something complex, but you can't find the right vocab / sentence structure to convey it in French? This course really helps you to conquer that type of learner's block. You learn how French people discuss literature and current events. Of course, it doesn't convert you into a fluent speaker - to do that, you gotta take this course and the ones beyond.

I learned a great deal about French literature and different aspects of the cultures of France and the broader Francophone worldin addition to learning tons of new French vocab and various French grammatical structures
It became easier to speak and read French. I also became more comfortable in French-speaking environments.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A big strength of the course is the discussion style everyone always had something great to bring to class. One weakness is I wish there were more assignments that you could perhaps do in groups so that I could improve my oral speaking skills more.
I believe that the course was well organized and taught.

The texts are interesting and lend themselves to a good discussion in class. It is also structured well; you have an ungraded first draft on every essay that gets extensive feedback. The tests are sometimes challenging but never too bad, and you always know exactly what will be on them.

strengths:
-lots of class time that helps improve speaking ability
-texts that are interesting and at an appropriate difficulty level
-discussion based classes 

things to improve:
-I thought that use of a supplementary grammar textbook would have helped me in supplementing material in the course packet

Strength: very interactive, since the class was 10 people we always had the space to speak when we wanted to. Madame Sherak is great about getting everyone involved in discussions!

Weakness: if you miss a day of reading it can feel difficult to catch up. There are some crunch times for the class when you have a test and then an essay due 2 days later.

Prof. Sherak is super kind and encouraging, and the course is very thorough in improving your knowledge and use of French! The main thing to keep in mind is that this course does require a lot of time to complete the work, but it's highly rewarding in improving your French.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, especially with Mme. Sherak.
Yes I would but only if they understand the rigor.
Yes! A great way to improve French. The class isn't too difficult, but Mme. Sherak is a great teacher, and you will learn a lot of French.
Yes

Yep! I had taken years of French before college, but this was my first French class at Yale. Really good way to get back into the language, and it's gotten me interested in taking more French down the line. Also the instructors really have course structure down to a science! They made their own textbook with all the material you need for the class (le livret). Definitely make good use of le livret if you take the course.
Yes, if you are willing to put in the time and are motivated to improve your French!
Yes. You are able to learn about various Francophones. Throughout the class you will become very comfortable with having productive discussions on French.
